workflow.name: Generate E-E-A-T SEO blog drafts for WordPress with OpenAI
workflow.description:
# AI E-E-A-T WordPress Blog Generator (n8n)

This workflow generates SEO-optimized, E-E-A-T compliant blog posts using a form input and publishes them as WordPress drafts with featured images.

## Features
- Form-based blog brief
- SEO metadata + outline generation
- Full HTML blog writing
- Featured image generation
- WordPress draft creation

## Requirements
- n8n v1.40+
- OpenAI API key
- WordPress REST API access

## Environment Variables
WP_SITE_URL=https://example.com
SITE_NAME=Your Website Name
PROJECT_CONTEXT=Your niche description

## How to Use
1. Import workflow JSON
2. Configure OpenAI & WordPress credentials
3. Set environment variables
4. Open the Form Trigger
5. Submit blog details
6. Draft appears in WordPress

## Notes
- Content is created as **draft**
- No credentials are included

parameters.formDescription: Fill this form to generate an SEO + E-E-A-T optimized blog post for example.com.

values.content:
=You are an SEO and real-estate content strategist.
You MUST return ONLY valid JSON. No markdown, no explanations.
If something is missing, use an empty string or empty array.

Assume the article will be published on example.com, a site selling BMRDA-approved residential plots around Mysore Road, Bangalore.

INPUT DATA (from form):
{
  "topic": "{{ $json.topic }}",
  "focus_keyword": "{{ $json.focus_keyword }}",
  "secondary_keywords_raw": "{{ $json.secondary_keywords }}",
  "target_audience": "{{ $json.target_audience }}",
  "search_intent": "{{ $json.search_intent }}",
  "tone": "{{ $json.tone }}",
  "word_count": {{ $json.word_count }},
  "author_name": "{{ $json.author_name }}",
  "author_experience": "{{ $json.author_experience }}",
  "experience_notes": "{{ $json.experience_notes }}"
}

Return JSON with this exact structure:
{
  "metaTitle": "",          // <= 60 characters, include focus keyword, clicky but natural
  "metaDescription": "",    // <= 160 characters, include focus keyword once, natural
  "focusKeyword": "",       // cleaned primary keyword
  "secondaryKeywords": [],   // cleaned array, max 6
  "h1": "",                 // main page H1
  "slug": "",               // SEO slug, lowercase, hyphenated
  "outline": [
    {
      "id": "intro",        // string id
      "heading": "",        // H2 heading
      "purpose": "",        // what this section does for reader
      "estimatedWordCount": 0
    }
  ],
  "faqQuestions": [],        // 3-7 long-tail questions
  "eeatNotes": {
    "authorBio": "",        // 1‚Äì2 sentence bio
    "trustSignals": [],      // 3‚Äì6 short strings (e.g., years of experience, project count)
    "experienceToHighlight": [] // 3‚Äì6 bullet-style points from notes
  },
  "imagePrompt": ""          // visual description for featured image, no text overlays
}

Guidelines:
- Outline should roughly fit total word_count.
- Focus on Bangalore, Mysore Road, BMRDA approvals, bank loans, and practical buyer advice when relevant.
- The JSON MUST be directly parsable.

parameters.prompt: =Featured image for a blog about: {{ $json.title }}. {{ $json.imagePrompt }}. Realistic, high quality, no text, landscape composition.

parameters.responseBody: ={ "message": "‚úÖ Draft created on example.com with AI content and featured image." }
={ "message": "‚ùå There was a problem generating metadata / outline. Please tweak the inputs and try again." }

parameters.content:
## About the Workflow

This workflow automatically creates a complete, SEO-ready WordPress blog post using AI  from idea to published draft.

You fill out a simple form with your topic, keywords, audience, tone, word count, and author details. The workflow then plans the article, generates SEO metadata, writes the content in clean HTML, creates a featured image, and publishes everything as a WordPress draft.

Its goal is to save time while maintaining high standards for SEO quality, structure, and E-E-A-T. The result is a fully packaged blog post ready for review and publishing.

Ideal for:
‚Ä¢ SEO teams  
‚Ä¢ Content writers and agencies  
‚Ä¢ Real estate and local business websites  
‚Ä¢ Website owners scaling content production  

Before running the workflow, generate a WordPress Application Password for an administrator user and store it in the WordPress credentials in n8n. Once set up, the process runs end-to-end with no manual publishing steps.

## 1.Form & Input Handling

The workflow starts with a form that collects the topic, keywords, audience, tone, and author experience. The Store Values node standardises this data so every following step receives clean and predictable input.

## 2.SEO Planning & Structure

This section builds the SEO foundation: metadata, headings, article outline, trust signals, and validation checks. The workflow stops early if essential SEO elements are missing.

## 3.Write ‚Üí Package ‚Üí Create Draft ‚Üí Generate Image

Using the approved structure, the workflow writes the full article, packages all post data, creates a WordPress draft, and generates a featured image so the post is content-complete.

## IMPORTANT

Generate an Application Password in WordPress for an administrator user.

Name your application: n8n-auto-blog  
Click Generate.

You will receive a password like:
ABCD EFGH IJKL MNOP

Save this password and add it to the WordPress credentials in n8n for this workflow to function correctly.

## 4.Image Upload, Linking & Final Response

The featured image is uploaded to WordPress and assigned to the post. A clear success or error response is returned so the user always knows the final result.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
